title: Five Best: Catherine Bailey on Evocations of Italy
text:
Christ Stopped at Eboli

By Carlo Levi (1945)

1In Fascist Italy, Mussolini banished some 15,000 dissidents into confino, or internal exile. Among them was Carlo Levi—doctor, poet, painter and anti-Fascist—who was sent to Lucania, a malaria-ridden region in the south. Levi was astonished by the primitive life he found there. “The seasons pass today over the toil of the peasants, just as they did three thousand years before Christ,” he wrote. “No message, human or divine, has reached this stubborn poverty.” In this remarkable...
description: From the author, most recently, of ‘A Castle in Wartime.’
